word:
MR No. 1483 - Observations on People and Scenery While Traveling

     (Written February 26, 1880, on the train en route to California, to her twin sister, Elizabeth Bangs.) 


     After I left you Monday, I was very sick. Tuesday [I was] nervous and suffering with headache, unable to sit up. Tuesday night we arrived at Council Bluffs. There we stopped off to visit Sister Milnor. After walking about half a mile, found her not at home. I had not tasted food through the day and was still suffering with nervous headache.
